Posts.Content: give them something to do for YOU! Like run the vacuum, fix a meal, clean the toilets. While I'm only headed to my 2nd round of chemo on Monday, I've already told my friends and family, that if they come to visit, be prepared to do something besides just visit me. We have four kids that have needs . . .right now I can't do it all. This was on the advice from my doctor's office - in chemo education. I've so far had people ask to take the kids for playmates, come over to clean those toilets, wash laundry bring us a meal or two or three. You have to take care of you first and if you let them know your true friends will understand.
Posts.Title: 3rd chemo on Friday...this is getting harder to do!

Posts.Content: I had eye twitching and lots of tearing. I had to keep apologizing to people and let them know I wasn't crying, my eyes were just watering very heavily right now. I'm almost 4 weeks out from my last chemo infusion and the twitching is slowing down greatly, along with a lot less tears. M
Posts.Title: Eye twitching
